oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Mark United Primitive Baptist Church
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Mark United Primitive Baptist Church
Maury Hill St., Spring Hill, Maury Co., TN
Color photograph of a one-story white church with gable roof. The view is of the front, showing a stairway leading to an open door on the left.

Originally known as Spring Hill United Primitive Baptist Church, St. Mark convened in 1871. It is likely that the current building was constructed around 1900. It was been an active community center and also served for a time as a school for African American children until Spring Hill Rosenwald school opened in 1920-21. The church remained active at the time of fieldwork.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Church buildings -- Tennessee
